li.a: Employee Rights - COVID-19 Families First Response Act
How A Flipped Math Classroom Works

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

br.h6: For the most up-to-date information, download the app and turn on push notifications!

div.p:
Incoming 2020/2021 Freshman Orientation:
Parents, if you have a child who will be a freshman next year, please attend the Zoom Orientation for incoming freshman on 04/30 from 7-8 pm. Your child has been invited via email, and has the link. This is for both parents and students.

It has been brought to our attention that some anonymous Instagram account has been created using the district's logos seeking senior information. The district is NOT behind this account. Please do NOT share any information with this account.
Happy Administrative Professionals Day to Lupe Shopteese and all of the hard work she does to keep HMS running smoothly.

We want to give a H-U-G-E shoutout to our transportation department for helping us deliver nearly 180 meals a day to our children living in the country. We couldn't do it without you! #WeR210 #InItTogether

p.a: Event: Golf: Boys JV @ Stanton County
Event: Golf: Boys Varsity - Hugoton Invitational

div.p: Mrs. Lomax, today was supposed to be your retirement party date. Since your party has to be postponed, we chose to send you a virtual party message today! What a strange but memorable way...
Please click on the link below to get your 2019-2020 HES yearbook ordered today. It has been a memorable school year so do not miss the chance of having it in pictures forever for just $25.00. ...

h3.a: Seesaw is the key to communication!

div.p: Intermediate Parents: Need the #1 way to help your child with our Continuous Learning Plan? Check your Seesaw daily. Please contact your child's teacher, if you need anything.
